name: Moustached Tamarin
description: A small primate with a broad head, small rounded ears, and a long, non-prehensile tail. It has an overall black coloration, transitioning to brown on the back. The nose, muzzle, and mouth area are white, with white fur forming a longer ‘mustache.’
spread_note: Central Amazon—northern Peru and western Brazil
reproduction: The female is pregnant for 145 days and gives birth to two offspring.
attractions: Tamarins are claw-footed monkeys with pointed, claw-like nails, except on their thumbs, which have flat nails. They live in family groups of 4 to 11 animals, centered around one breeding female. They spend most of their time in tree canopies, moving with incredible agility.
breeding: The Moustached Tamarin is one of the rarest tamarin species in zoos. Prague Zoo, one of only two in Europe, has kept them since 2008, starting with a female from Zurich.
